xs:annotation.xs:documentation: Schema defining the Selection Query XML language. All elements in the schema may be referred to by using the id and ref attributes. When using the ref attribute in an element, all other attributes and child elements are ignored and should not be specified. To indicate that an attribute or a child element is "required" when not using a reference, the keyword "mandatory" is used throughout this documentation.
Represents any element that can act as a filter.
Represents any element that can act as a value.
Represents any element that can act as a query.
End of group definitions Start of attribute group definitions
Unique identifier of the element within the document, can be referenced through the ref attribute
Reference to another element of the document through the id attribute value. When present, all other attributes are ignored and should not be set, even those usually described as mandatory.
Free text attribute that can be used by a specific engine to identify elements being processed.
Flag indicating if the value should be bound to the query (? in SQL) or included into it.
Mandatory. Unique identifier of the query in the resulting SQL statement.
Represents all custom fields of a given type for the class targeted by the given path.

Represents an amount value: a number with its currency.
Represents a boolean value.
Represents a type of class. It can represent a specific class type by specifying the "type" attribute or the type of the targeted entity by specifying the "path" attribute.
Path targeting the entity type onto which the filtering/sorting/... will be applied. Same definition as the field path attribute.
Specific entity type onto which the filtering/sorting/... will be applied. Same definition as the query projected class attribute.

Represents a custom expression that will be sent as is to the engine processing it. Formatted values can refer to parameters of the value or of the search context. To do so, the following notation must be used within the formatted value: :parameter_name .
The base value of the custom element (mandatory)
Name of the parameter. That name is used to reference the parameter in the pre-formatted expression.

Represents an already formatted value that will be sent as is to the engine processing it. Formatted values can refer to parameters of the value or of the search context. To do so, the following notation must be used within the formatted value: :parameter_name .

Represents an already formatted filter that will be sent as is to the engine processing it. Formatted filters can refer to parameters of the filter or of the search context. To do so, the following notation must be used within the formatted filter: :parameter_name .

Represents the type of date value.

Represents the current system date and time as in the SYSDATE SQL expression. If this option is selected, then no value is required for the element.

Represents the SQL CASE clause. It finds the corresponding value by checking case criteria. If it matches, it returns the return value; otherwise it returns null or the default value if specified.
Collection that holds the cases.
A case is made of a criterion followed by a value: the case criterion that will be checked and the return value that will be returned if the case criterion matches.
Default value if no case match.

Represents the SQL CASE clause. It finds the corresponding value by comparing case values against the base value. If it matches, it returns the return value; otherwise it returns null or the default value if specified.
Base value against which case values are compared..
Collection that holds the cases.
A case is made of two values: the case value that will be compared against the base value and the return value that will be returned if the case value matches.
Default value if no case match.

Represents the sorting order for this value. The default value of true sorts the value in ascending order (ASC SQL keyword), the other possible value of false sorts in a descending order (DESC SQL keyword).

Unique identifier of the element in the resulting SQL statement. This value is used to distinguish query elements that use the same model entities or fields. Oracle type used to group multiple values into a single row (CAST MULTISET). The inner value must be a query in order to group values.
Path of the field to whom the value will be set. Used to reroute a value or to indicate the field that will store the computed value.

This class serves as a common ancestor for all multilingual, administrable entities. It defines fields and methods that should be common across all those entities.
Indicates if the given language is active (or usable). Inactive languages are seen only when administering an entity, and are not considered usable throughout the system.

Indicates if the given language is the base language for this entity.
The entity must have a base language, and that language must also be supported by the entity.

A certification is one element that defines the talent profile of a candidate or employee. The notion of certification refers to an official recognition of skills and knowledge in a specific area. A certification is emitted by an authorized provider.
All certifications are defined in the standard Taleo library - it is not possible for customers to add new elements. However, customers can activate/deactivate elements.
The creation date of the entity
This attribute describes the certification.
The date of the last modification of the entity
This attribute is the certification identifier. Use the Number to search and identify the certification to update.
To be documented.
The Administration Entity status of the administration entity
A competency is knowledge, a skill or an ability. Competencies are contained in the Taleo Competencies List.
Customer specific multilingual competency name.
Multilingual description of the competency. This field supports rich-text markup. Descriptions may also be contextualized to specific OLF values using competency definitions.
Multilingual plain text version of the description.
Taleo unique identifier used as entity key.
Holds the last modification date of the entity.
The competency categories associated to the competency.
The competency definitions associated to the competency.
The competency group associated to the competency.
Competency provider associated to the competency.
Customer specific competency type associated to competency.
Default competency type associated to competency.
Network job fields associated to Competency.
Primary network job field associated to Competency.
Rating model associated to Competency.
Sub-competencies associated to the competency.
A competency category is a way for classifying competencies. Competencies are mainly used for filtering purposes. A competency can be associated to many categories.
The multilingual description of the competency category.
Holds the last modification date of the entity.
The competencies associated to the competency category.
A Competency Definition provides a specific description for an associated context. It overrides the default competency description when the competency is used within a specific context.
The competency associated to the competency definition.
A competency group is a way for classifying competencies. Groups are mainly used for filtering and display grouping purposes. A competency can be associated to one group.
The multilingual description of the competency group.
The display sequence of the competency group.
Holds the last modification date of the entity.
A competency provider owns a library of competencies and other related content that can be used by the client.
The description of the competency provider
The parent competency provider.
Competency types provide a way to group and organize competencies. There are three types of competencies: job specific, language, and behavioral competencies.
Unique identifier of the competency type.
A rating dimension offers a scale of values to select from to evaluate a competency or goal. The rating dimension type determines the usage pattern of this part of the evaluation.
Holds the last modification date of the entity.
The provider of the Rating Dimension

The rating dimension type determines the usage pattern of this part of the evaluation.
The types LEVEL, INTEREST, EXPERIENCE and LAST_USED represent the dimensions also used in the recruiting product and candidate profiles. The SCORE dimension is the one mainly used in the Performance Management product for performance reviews.
A rating model is a set of rating dimensions each representing an aspect of the evaluation. A rating model is used to evaluate a business item, typically a competency but other uses are supported.
Holds the last modification date of the entity.
The provider of the Rating Model
The rating value is a qualitative and quantitative (numerical) way of describing an evaluation state on a rating dimension scale.
Defines the order in which to display the rating values (may or may not correspond to the numerical value sequence)
The name or display label of the rating value.
The internal unique identifier.
The numerical value corresponding to this rating value - mandatory as it is used in the aggregation and normalization calculations.
A sub-competency is a constituent element of a competency. It describes a competency with more granularity.
The provider of the SubCompetency

Job Level lookup values. It determines the available job levels in the system.

A job role is a generic definition of job that applies to all employees - as opposed to a position, which is a specific instance of a job. Actually, a position can be defined as a job role joined to an organization and a location. A job role has a code, name and definition for documentation purposes and also supports the concept of a job profile that specifies the requirements to execute the job.
The JobRole internal identifier specified by the customer. Used for referencing a job role identifier known in another external system for integration purposes.
Holds the last modification date of the entity.
The job field of the job role.
The job level of the job role.
Job Schedule lookup values. It determines the available job schedule types in the system.
Job Shift lookup values. It determines the available job shifts in the system.
Job Type lookup values. It determines the available job types in the system.
It indicates the actions that a pool is made for. Example the pool can be for succession planning.
It indicates the type of the pool item that the pool will contains.

A position is an occurrence of a Job Role. It can also be represented by the chair. Positions are hierarchical. It defines the business employee structure. Typically, the topmost positions are managed by HR team in the system. Other positions can be managed by managers.
The criticality on a scale of 1 to 5. However, in the current products, only a criticality level of 5 is considered "critical".
The JobPosition internal identifier specified by the customer. Used for referencing a job position identifier known in another external system for integration purposes.

The target start date of the position - typically use to manage new positions.

The location associated to the position.
The organization associated to the position.
The parent position in the position hierarchy.

The Prescreening Form to which the skill is linked
The profiency level used as a minimum level in the detailed format
The skill
This is the visibility for candidates associted with this prescreeningFormSkill.
This is a display option. Possible values can be radio button, check box, drop down, etc.

This is a disqualifier result. Each possible answer of a disqualification question must have a disqualifier result. It indicates the behavior result to the system when the candidate provides its answers to disqualification questions.
Possible values can be Passed, To Be Verified or Failed.
This is the type of employment equity question. Ethnicity, race and gender are a few examples configured in the system. This information is se: for a question only when TypeOfQuestion = EEO
This is the format of Question. It indicates how it can be answered. Possible values are Single Answer, Multiple Answer and Text Answer.

This is the association between a company job field and a question. This information is pertinent for Prescreening and Disqualification questions. It indicates the pertinence of a question according to associated job fields.
Indicates if the association between the job field and the question is pertinent for a Prescreening Model. This information is applicable only to Prescreening questions.
Indicates if the association between the job field and the question is pertinent for a Candidate Profiler. This information is applicable only to Prescreening questions.
Indicates the sequence ordering of the question in a Prescreening Model when this question appears to be pertinent according to the associated job field.
Indicates the sequence ordering of the question in a Candidate Profiler when this question appears to be pertinent according to the associated job field.
This is the associated company job field.
This is the associated question.

This is the association between a company location and a question. This information is pertinent for Prescreening and Disqualification questions. It indicates the pertinence of a question according to associated locations.
Indicates if the association between the location and the question is pertinent for a Prescreening Model. This information is applicable only to Prescreening questions.
Indicates if the association between the location and the question is pertinent for a Candidate Profiler. This information is applicable only to Prescreening questions.
Indicates the sequence ordering of the question in a Prescreening Model when this question appears to be pertinent according to the associated location.
Indicates the sequence ordering of the question in a Candidate Profiler when this question appears to be pertinent according to the associated location.
This is the associated company location.
This is the associated question.

This is a possible answer. It is associated to only one question and represents one of the possible answers a candidate can choose from when answering to a question. The format of the question must be single or multiple answer, not text answer.
This is the description of this possible answer.
This is the sequence ordering of this possible answer among all other possible answers of the same question.
Indicates if answer expects an explanation Note this only apply for Disqualification Questions
Indicates if this possible answer is the "not specified" value
This is the associated disqualifier result for this possible answer. This information is set when the format of the question is disqualification question.
This is the associated question for this possible answer.

This is a question. Question can be used for many purposes but a given question is used in only one creno. The TypeOfQuestion indicates the creno (Prescreening, Disqualification, Employment Equity, etc.) When the format of the question is not Text Answer, the question comes with a set of possible answers from which the user can choose from. If it is a disqualification question, each possible answer comes with a disqualifier result. A disqualifer question its format cannot be Text Answer.
Indicates the creation date of this question.
Indicates the description in all defined languages for this question.
Indicates the sequence ordering of this question. This information is applicable only for employment equity questions.
Introduction text to invite candidate to provide explanation when a Disqualification answer need explanation Note this only apply for Disqualification Questions
Indicates the last modification date of this question.
Indicates the number of lines of text allowed for this question. this information is applicable only to Text Answer type of questions.
This is the associated display option for this question.
This is the associated format of question for this question.
This is the associated network location for this question. A location is associated only to employment equity questions.
This is the associated list of possible answers for this question. There are possible answers only to single and multiple answers question.
To be documented.
This is the associated scope for this question.
This is the associated type of question for this question.
This is the visibility for candidates associted with this question.

This is the question scope. It indicates the scope of the question and where it can be used. Possible values are Global, Local and Not Applicable. Global (or Generic) : The question can be managed and used in many contexts globally troughout the application. Questions created in the Precreening Question Library are set Global. Local (or Specific) : The question only exists in a specific area and is not used in any other context. For example, a question can be created and used for a single requisition and cannot be used for any other requisitions. Not Applicable : The question scope has no signification for the given question. It is useless.

This is the type of question. It indicates the purpose of the question, what it is used for. Possible values can be For Prescreening, For Employment Equity, For Disqualification, etc, as configured in the system.

This is a skill. A skill is defined in the system by Taleo. A client has the ability to build its own list of skills based on all skills provided by Taleo.
Taleo skills are linked to network job fields and are not editable by the client. The visibility for candidates is editable by the client.
The competency corresponding to this skill.
This is the associated visibility for candidate for this skill.

Kind of application that represents an application of a candidate on a specific requisition. The application can be entered by the candidate, a recruiter, a referrer or an agent. As for the general application, the specific application contains information like: - The candidate's skills assessment and answers to the requisition questions - The candidate's resume (structured and/or not) - The candidate's score and ranking - The studies and experiences of the candidate - Potential comments This information may be different from the general application information.
This field define the bill rate use for an application on a contingent requisition type. The bill rate proposed by the supplier.
This field define the sales tax use for an application on a contingent requisition type Determine if the sales tax must be charged to the customer.
The date to which the latest move was perform in the selection workflow.
The date to which the candidate is supposed to start working.

The application disqualifier result date (knockout status). The date when the application disqualifier result has been evaluated according to the candiidate answers to the disqualification questions. A corresponding disqualifier result is set.
The date to which the request eeo informations was sent to the candidate.
Date when the application becomes expired. Value is empty when the application is valid forever.
The grade of the candidate entered by an operator. The grade is independent of the score obtained by the candidate for the questions and the skills.
Indicate if the application is at the initial status of the workflow.

Internal use. Not exportable. Not importable. This field may become asynchronous with the DB. This happens when a step that was not restricted become restricted. The applications that were already on that step keep their old value until they move on the CSW and the value get recomputed.
Date when the candidate applied/re-applied the last time on this requisition
Internal use only. Not exportable. Not importable. This the key that has been use to start the onboarding process.
This field define the pay rate use for an application on a contingent requisition type The rate the worker is paid
Not exportable and not importable. This field is used from the candidate list.
The date to which the regret letter has been sent.
The date to which the candidate did came back in career section to complete his information.
The date to which the request more information email has been sent to the candidate.
To be documented.
To be documented.
Define the requisition number that the candidate applied in the supplier system. This field is never display to the customer.
Define the worker id that the candidate receive in the supplier system. This field is never display to the customer.
The status of the ace alert email, namely if it were sent or not to the operators.
To be documented.
Indicate the state of the application. This field is calculated and updated only by the candidate selection workflow. It cannot be imported directly.
The list of locations that the candidate applied to.
To be documented.
The application's last Candidate Selection Workflow status. The place where the candidat is in the recruiting process. This denormalized field is their for performance issue.
The application's last Candidate Selection Workflow step. The place where the candidat is in the recruiting process for a given status. This denormalized field is their for performance issue.
The application's Candidate Selection Workflow trace. The place where the candidat is in the recruiting process.
The Candidate Selection Worklow that is used to process applications. This denormalized field is their for performance issue.
To be documented.
The application disqualifier result (knockout status). The application disqualifier result is set at the moment the candidate assesses himself to disqualification questions.
Link to the application related to this expectation offer.
A meeting that the candidate is scheduled to assist.
The list of offers that were presented to the candidate for that application.
The results of the candidate for the application. The results contains informations like : if the candidate is an ace candidate, his score, the number of assets the candidate met, etc...
The overrided profile information that applies specifically for this application.
The requisition on which this application is linked
The status of the "Request More Information" letter.
To be documented.
This relation define the values type for the income tax use in the contingent world.
The number of assets/required for candidates criteria that the candidate meets for the requisition he applies to.
The number of required for all candidates criteria that the candidate meets for the requisition he applies to.
The number of assets for external candidates criteria that the candidate meets for the requisition he applies to.
The number of assets for internal candidates criteria that the candidate meets for the requisition he applies to.
The number of assets for all candidates criteria that the candidate meets for the requisition he applies to.
The number of required for external candidates criteria that the candidate meets for the requisition he applies to.
The number of required for internal candidates criteria that the candidate meets for the requisition he applies to.
This entity is a lookup containing the information about the status representing the progression of an application within a specific step.
This field indicates whether the application status reach the threshold to collect the EEO/Affirmative information or not.
This field indicates if it's possible or not to collect the EEO/Affirmative Action information when an applicant has reached the status.
This field indicates whether the state is a final state or not in the application flow.
This field represents the position of the state among the others in the progression of an application.
Entity that represents an evaluation score of a candidate on a specific requisition. Evaluation score is entered by interviewers.

Contains all the information about the results of the candidate when he/she applied on a requisition. The following information is kept: whether the candidate is an ace, the number of assets the candidate has, the number of required criteria the candidate has, and whether or not the candidate has all the required criteria specified in the requisition he/she applied on.
Indicates if the candidate has all the required criteria specified in the requisition that he/she applied on.
Indicates if the candidate is an ace.
The number of assets that the candidate meets for the requisition he/she applies on.
The number of required criteria that the candidate meets for the requisition he/she applies on.
The score the candidate obtained when he/she applied on an application.
The application for which we have the results.
This class contains all the states for the "Request More Info" letter.
This class is use in the contingent world and define a US income tax distinction as to how the contractor is paid.
This entity contains the definition of a user-defined field.
Indicates how many values a given UDF can contain. This field only applies to UDFs of the selection and lookup types.
A textual description of the user-defined field. This description can be completed in one or more languages.
An alphanumeric identifier that is unique across all user-defined field definitions.

Links the UDF of the lookup type to its lookup entity.
The lookup entity provides the selection of values presented to the user.
Indicates which metaclass this user-defined field is defined on. For example, CSUser, Requisition, Offer are entities that support UDFs.
For user-defined fields of type "Selection", this relation indicates that the UDF uses a private selection. As such, the values of that selection can only be used by this UDF.
Indicates the type of user-defined field for this UDF definition.

For user-defined fields of type "Selection," this relation indicates that the UDF uses a shared selection.
A shared selection exists independently of the UDFs that use it, and can be used by multiple UDFs.
Defines the possible types of User Defined Fields.
The unique identifier of the UDF type.
This is the employment equity question version for the USA only. It indicates the version of employment equity in the USA. This information is set only for employment equity questions.
This is the employment equity establishment.
This is the multilingual description for this employment equity establishment.

This is the employment equity job category. Each job category is associated to a Taleo location. Job categories are organized in a hierarchical structure. The first level represents the category; the second level is the group. Job categories are also organized by version so there can be more than one structure for each location.
This is the entity key
This is the associated list of descriptions for this employment equity job category.
This is the associated Taleo location for this employment equity job category.
This is the associated parent element for this employment equity job category.
This is the employment equity job category description.
Indicates the description.
Indicates the locale of the description.
This is the associated employment equity job category for this employment equity job category description.
This is the associated version for this employment equity job category

The CSWMotive entity represents a motive that can be created to describe an event (for example, 'Canceled the interview'). The CSWMotive also has a mnemonic and an availability flag which are inherited from the CSWObject. The CSWMotive is described as a Qualifier in the application administration section.
The CSWMotive multilingual description.
The CSWMotive multilingual name.

The CSWMotiveDomain represents a set of configured motives. The CSWMotiveDomain also has a mnemonic and an availability flag which are inherited from the CSWObject. The CSWMotiveDomain is described as a Qualifier Group in the application administration section.
The CSWMotiveDomain multilingual description.
The CSWMotiveDomain multilingual name.
The CSWMotiveDomain can be associated with one or more CSWMotiveDomainCSWMotiveUsage.
The CSWMotiveDomainCSWMotiveUsage is the intersection between motives and motive domains.
CSWMotive associated with this CSWMotiveDomainCSWMotiveUsage.
The CSWMotiveDomain associated with this CSWMotiveDomainCSWMotiveUsage.

The CSWObject is an abstract entity providing an availability flag and a mnemonic to many of the CSW entities; CSWAction, CSWMotive, CSWMotiveDomain, CSWOperation, CSWStatus, CSWStatusShortcut, CSWStep and CSWWorkflow.
The 'available' attribute is a Boolean flag specifying if the entity is available or not.
The 'mnemonic' attribute is simply an identifier for the CSW entity. It's not multilingual.
The CSW Status represents a portion of a Step. The steps are made of statuses and when these statuses are completed, the step is considered complete.
Boolean flag specifying if the tracking history for this status can have a modified event date.
The CSWStatus multilingual description.
The CSWStatus multilingual name.
Link to the application state.
Link to the CSWStatusMotiveDomainUsage which is basically the intersection between MotiveDomains and Status.
The CSWStatusMotiveDomainUsage is an entity of intersection between Status and MotiveDomains.
The motive domain to associate with the status.
The Status to associate with the motive domain.
The CSWStatusUsage entity is used to determine the usage of a status. A CSWStep is made of many CSWStatusUsage.
Boolean flag specifying if all the constraints must be valid.
Boolean flag specifying if this status can be used by the autoflow. False is the default value.
Boolean flag specifying if conditional completeness is allowed.
Boolean flag specifying if the CSWStatusUsage is the initial step (step initial one).
Boolean flag specifying is the status is meeting compliant. False is the default value.
This is a flag specifying the type of notification: none, recruiter, hiring manager, etc..
This is the id of the Change status button shortcut which can be configured in the admin section.
This flag specifies the type of comments: optional or mandatory.
This is a flag specifying the type of Motives (qualifiers).
Link to the CSWStepProgressionLevel, which is a lookup defining the state of the step associated with this status, it can be NOT_STARTED, IN_PROGRESS or COMPLETED.
Link to the CSWStatus associated with this Status usage.
Link to the CSWStep associated with this status usage.
The CSWStep represents the elements of a workflow. A workflow contains steps which contain statuses. Usage entities are used to group these elements together.
The CSWStep multilingual description.
The CSWStep multilingual name.
The CSWStep multilingual short name. It is used in lists.
Link to the Application state which indicates the state of the current application.
Link to the StatusUsage which represents the usages for this step.
This lookup gives a progression indicator for a status in the context of its step.
The CSWStepUsage defines the usage for a step by associating a step to a workflow. A workflow is made of step usages.
Boolean flag specifying if a conditional entry is allowed. The default value is False.
Boolean flag specifying if the step is mandatory. False is the default value.
Flag specifying the type of notifications.
Boolean flag specifying the step is restricted.
Link to the step associated with the workflow.
Link to the workflow associated with the step.
This entity stores the progression of the candidate on the selection workflow

The CSWUsage is an abstract entity providing an availability flag and a sequence to some CSW entities such as motives, operations, steps and actions. Also the implementations of the CSWUsage entity specifies how the entity should be used.
Boolean flag specifying if the entity is available or not.
Integer specifying the entity sequence.
A CSWWorkflow is basically a set of steps a candidate will go through. Flags, actions, conditions, etc.can be associated to these steps.
Boolean flag specifying if this workflow is the default workflow. When a requisition is created, the default workflow is selected.
The CSWWorkflow multilingual description.
The CSWWorkflow multilingual name.
To be documented.
To be documented.
Link to the standard hire type of the CSWWorkflow
To be documented.
A workflow can have one or more CSWStepUsage. A CSWStepUsage is basically a CSWUsage but is specific to a CSWStep.
Represent the document file for the recruiting process.
Contains the different HRMS that can provide data to the system (0 = Taleo system)
A description of the HRMS System.
Link to children HRMS.
Link to parent HRMS.
Represents the different citizenship statuses.
Represents data that is common to Requisition and Job Template.
Additional information regarding JobInformation.
This field indicates if candidates are to be declined on other requisitions when the requisition is closed (fill).
This field indicates if candidates are to be rejected when the requisition is closed (cancel).
The base locale for the JobInformation description.
Median bill rate of a requisition.
Bill rate not to exceed (maximum).
The creation date of JobInformation.
Identifies the flow type dimension from which the job information has been created.
The department string value of JobInformation (used when Department is not enabled).
Indicates the languages activated for JobInformation.
The external description of JobInformation (multilingual).
The internal description of JobInformation (multilingual).
Public Referral Bonus Amount.
Indicates if Public Referral Bonus is enabled.
Employee Referral Bonus Amount.
Indicates that the Employee Referral Bonus is enabled.
The high quartile salary of JobInformation. Marketplace comparisons for comparable jobs; usually from salary surveys from HR consulting companies such as Mercer.
The Job Board Description of JobInformation (multilingual).
The job grade of JobInformation. Standard level of job or job series within the pay structure of an organization.
The last modification date of JobInformation.

The low quartile salary of JobInformation. Marketplace comparisons for comparable jobs; usually from salary surveys from HR consulting companies such as Mercer. Added to RS based on contractual obligation to FESCO.

The mid-point salary of JobInformation. Marketplace comparisons for comparable jobs; usually from salary surveys from HR consulting companies such as Mercer. Added to RS based on contractual obligation to FESCO.
Indicates the number of people to hire.
The others costs of JobInformation.
The external qualification of JobInformation (multilingual).
The internal qualification of JobInformation (multilingual).
The relocation costs of JobInformation.
To be documented.
To be documented.
To be documented.
The sourcing budget of JobInformation.
The JobInformation title (multilingual).
The travel costs of JobInformation.
Indicates if the requisition has an unlimited number of hires.
Indicates the number of day(s) a submission is valid for the requisition.
Indicates if the submissions on this requisition must have a validity period. see validityPeriod for the number of day(s) a submission is valid for the requisition
JobInformation bonus currency.
JobInformation budget currency.
The citizenship status of the JobInformation.
Link to JobInformation contigent currency rate values.
The creator of JobInformation.
Link to the candidate selection workflow of the requisition.
The employment equity job category of JobInformation.
The employment equity establishement of JobInformation.
Link to the group of job information.
Link to the hire type of JobInformation .
The job field of JobInformation.
Link to the job level of JobInformation .
Link to JobInformation job role value associated to requisition.
The schedule of JobInformation.
The job shift of JobInformation.
The job type of JobInformation.
Link to the requisition offer parameter of JobInformation.
The organization of JobInformation.
The other lcoations of JobInformation.
The overtime status of JobInformation.
The meta prescreening form (same value as the non meta).
The primary location of JobInformation.
The education program of JobInformation.
The recruiter owner of JobInformation.
JobInformation education level.
JobInformation will travel link.
JobTemplate represents a model for creating requisitions or other templates.
The start date for the template.
The end date for the template.
The job code (unique identifier) for JobTemplate that can be assigned by clients.
Reference to a base job template.
JobTemplate department link.
JobTemplate department information.
Reference to the job information.
Reference to the job template state.
Represents the different states of a job template: active, draft, inactive, deleted.
Represents the different overtime statuses (exempt, non exempt).
This entity is an electronic media defining a job site, a career site, a news group, a mailing list, etc. This is a site where the job offers are posted.
This field represents the external system related to the job board. For instance, a job board coming from an external system like eQuest.
This field indicates if the posting on the job board is free or not.
This field indicates the duration of the posting (1=30 days, 2=60 days, 3=45 days). When it is null, this means that there is no term (not applicable).
This field represents the media name related to the job board provided by an external system like eQuest.
This field is the type of the job board. The possible types are: (1=Free Job Board, 2=Fee-based Job Board, 3=News Group, 4=Mailing List, 5=External, 6=Intranet, 7=Staffing Agency Portal).
Link to the recruitment source of the Jobboard.
This class contains all the jobboard type for a jobboard.

The Attendee entity is an abstraction of the meeting expected participants. The meeting organizer is also considered as an attendee. The three possible types of attendee are CSUserAttendee, UserAttendee, and UnresgistredAttendee. The link between the Attendee and the Meeting is done by the MeetingAttendee who associates a MeetingAttendeeRole to an Attendee.
There is always an associated Attendee for each MeetingAttendee.
The CSUserAttendee is the meeting attendee representing the candidate, only one CSUserAttendee is allowed per meeting. A meeting does not necessarily have a CSUserAttendee.
A CSUserAttendee is always linked to a CSUser.
Contains the mandatory field that is to the implementation of the iCalendar specification.
The sequence as described in the iCalendar specification.
The unique identifier as described in the iCalendar specification.

The meeting represents an assembly of users (attendees) at a given place at a given time. The meeting contains all the required information for the encounter. A meeting can have one or more MeetingAttendees, each MeetingAttendee links an Attendee to the role (MeetingAttendeeRole) he/she will play during the meeting.
The comments are provided by the meeting organizer and are useful to give instructions or extra information about the meeting.
Date of the meeting creation.
Date defining when the meeting will end.
Flag used to determinate if the candidate file is attached (to the email or to the response center).
Flag used to determinate if the requisition file is attached (to the email or to the response center).
Date of the last update.
Defines the place where the meeting will occur.
Date defining when the meeting will start.
Defines what the meeting is about.
Zero or one ICalendar is associated to each meeting.
The MeetingAttendee is always associated with one Meeting.
A MeetingReminderDuration can be associated with a meeting.
A MeetingType is associated to each meeting (presently only INTERVIEW is supported).
A Meeting can be associated or not to a PreselectionApplication.
A meeting always refers to one RSTimeZone, eventually this relation is considered when a reminder is sent.
The MeetingAttendee links the Attendee and the MeetingAttendeeRole; it determines what role the attendee will play during the meeting.
One of three possible types of attendees--CSUserAttendee, UserAttendee, and UnregisteredAttendee--associated with the MeetingAttendee.
The Meeting to which this MeetingAttendee is associated.
To each MeetingAttendee there is always a MeetingAttendeeRole associated.
The MeetingAttendeeRole is a multilingual lookup entity that describes the attendee's role at the meeting. Values can be 'organizer,' 'candidate,' etc.
The MeetingReminderDuration is a multilingual lookup entity that defines when the user will be reminded of the meeting.
The MeetingReminderDuration specifies how many minutes before the meeting the user will be warned.
The MeetingType is a multilingual lookup entity proposing the type of meeting (currently only INTERVIEW is allowed).
The UnregisteredAttendee represents the attendee who is unknown to the system. It is the opposite of UserAttendee. The only available information about the attendee is his/her email address.
The email address of the unregistered attendee.
The UserAttendee is a meeting attendee who is known by the system. For example, the meeting organizer is a UserAttendee.
The user attendee always refers to a known system user.

The ArtAbstractOffer entity is an abstraction of the possible types of offers. The ones related to the candidate are ArtCompetitiveOffer, ArtCurrentJob, ArtExpectation and ArtOffer. You can have an offer related to the Requisition which is the ArtRequesitionOfferParameter.
A multilingual string specifying the annual bonus.
The captureDate represents the creation date of the offer.
Multilingual string specifying the car allowance.
Multilingual string specifying the commission amount.
Specifies the number of working days per week.
Multilingual string specifying the expense account.
The hoursPerDay represents the number of hours per day the candidate will work.
System generated. Every offer is given a unique sequential name.
Entry allowing the user who creates the offer to provide some information.
Multilingual string specifying other bonus values.
Multilingual string specifying other compensation.
Value resulting from the calculation of the salary divided by the pay period.
Specifies the amount allocated if relocation is required.
The salary represents the employee's wage.
The signOnBonus represents the amount offered to the candidate when signing the offer.
Multilingual string specifying the stock amount.
Multilingual string specifying the stock option.
The targetStartDate specifies the date the candidate is scheduled to start working.
Vacation is an integer value. In the UI, this is combined with the vacation type to express the desired value.
Link to the commissionType which is a user-defined selection. The commissionType and the commissionAmount together represent the desired commission.
Links to currency. An offer can or cannot have an associated currency. It is editable lookup entity and represents, for example, the currency of the salary.
Link to an offerTitle. This is a lookup entity expressing the different titles an offer can have.
Link to the ArtPayFrequencyBasis. This is a lookup entity expressing the different possibilities of pay basis.
Link to a user-defined selection which represents the possible relocation types.
Link to a user-defined selection which represents the possible stock option types.
Link to a user-defined selection which represents the possible stock types.
Link to ArtVacationType which represents the following vacation types: WEEKS, DAYS or PERCENT.

The competitive offer information accompanies the candidate and indicates at what levels offers were made. This is useful in determining whether or not an offer is to be made to the candidate, and it serves as a guideline to the type (level) of offer that must be made. In future versions, this information will also be useful in providing market information for specific jobs.
Multilingual string field used to provide a description for the competitive job.
Multilingual string field used to hold the competitive job title.
The date when the competitive offer was captured.
Multilingual string field used to capture the other competitive employer values. This occurs when the competitive employer does not belong to the known employers list.
The competiviteSequence defines the capture sequence and is used to determine the competitive offer name.
Link to a CieEmployer which is considered a competitive employer.
Link to a CieJobField which is considered a competitive job field.
Link to a NetworkLocation

The ArtCurrentJob is used to provide information about the candidate current job when applicable. The ArtCurrentJob extends ArtAbstractOffer and provides also all the necessary information about the current candidate wage.
A multilingual string field that provides a description for the current job.
Multilingual string field used to hold the current job title.
The date when the currentJob offer was captured.
A multilingual string field used to capture the other employer value for the current job. This occurs when the current job employer does not belong to the known employers list.
Link to a CieEmployer that is the current employer.
Link to a CieJobField that is the current job field.
Link to a NetworkLocation.
The EOfferType is a resource lookup. The initial values are StatticDefaultTaleoEOffer and TransitionBasedEOffer.

Represents a basic meta-entity that captures the expectations from a candidate who applied on a given requisition at any time (as long as the application exists). Candidate expectations are basically the terms that the candidate would admittedly accept or refuse. These are gathered through a process that some may refer to as the "Test offer". It provides the user with crucial data regarding candidate expectations at both ends of the spectrum (low end range = Will definitely refuse, high end range = Can't refuse or Will definitely accept). Candidate expectations also include the information as to the terms that the candidate enjoys in his "current job".
Date when the offer expectation was captured.
Link to the expectation offer related to this application.
Link to an expectation type. This is a lookup that defines what the candidate may do. For example;:WILL_REFUSE, WILL_ACCEPT, DESIRES.
At design time, the initial values are "willAccept", "desires" and "willRefuse". Please refer to class implementation for the most up-to-date list of values.

The ExtensionMechanism is a multilingual lookup enumerating the valid mechanisms to extend an offer. These values are not customizable. The initial values are "e-mail", "verbally", "letter" and "e-offer". Please refer to database for currently used values.
ArtOffer represents an employment proposition to be eventually communicated to a specific candidate.
The date the candidate accepted the offer. This happens usually after the extendedDate.
The date the candidate is supposed to start his/her new job.
Indicates if the offer has been approved and when.
Represents the date the offer will cease to be valid.
The date the offer was communicated to the candidate.
The date the candidate refused the offer. This happens usually after the extendedDate.

The sequence is an incremented value used to generate the offer name. It is also useful for finding the current or last offer. It is a sequence formed by the offers made to the same candidate on the same application.
A flag indicating if the start date is final or tentative.
The PreselectionApplication associated with this offer.
The [ApprovalContext] links the Offer to the whole approbation process defined by the [ProcessDefinition].
Refrence to the ArtExtensionMechanism, when the offer has been communicated to the candidate this defines the extension mechanism which can be E_MAIL, VERBALLY or LETTER.

Refence to the ArtOfferStatus, determines the current state of the offer which can be DRAFT, CANCELED, APPROVAL_IN_PROGRESS, APPROVAL_REJECTED, APPROVED, EXTENDED, RESCINDED,IN_NEGOTIATION, REFUSED, ACCEPTED, RENEGED.
User for which an action is requrired when the approbation ends successfully.

The ArtOfferStatus represents the possible states of the offer; these are only applicable for an ArtOffer since it is the only one that can evolve. When an ArtOffer is created, the default value is DRAFT. The process starts till a final state, such as REFUSED or ACCEPTED. Many other states are possible.

The ArtOfferTitle is a multilingual representation of the different titles that an Offer can have. These titles provide descriptive information. The initial values are "Current Offer," "Offer," "Requisition," "Will Refuse," "Current Job," "Will Accept," "Competitive Offer Terms," "Extended Offer," "Counter Offer," etc.. Please refer to the database for currently used values.
The ArtPayFrequencyBasis is used to express the frequency the user will be paid. Many values are possible from DAILY to YEARLY.
The ArtRequisitionOfferParameter represents a meta-entity encapsulating the offer parameters and behavior of the Offer aspects for a Requisition.
The ArtRequisitionOfferParameter represents a meta-entity encapsulating the offer parameters and behavior of the Offer aspects of a Requisition.
An attribute that calculates the maximum annual salary in the reference currency (USD).
The ArtVactionType is a multilingual lookup entity representing the different possible vacation units: weeks, days, percent.
Make a link between a JobPosition and a JobTemplate, used in recruiting
To be documented.
This entity represents a requisition posted on a specific job board for a determined period of time.
This field represents the end of the requisition availability on the job board. When null, the posting is always available on the job board (ongoing).
This field is the date when the posting was done by the user. tt is updated each time the status changes.

This field indicates if the Apply Online button is to be displayed in the Career Section. The option is set at posting. Default value set to true when the associated CareerSite has a job specific application flow.

This entity represents a requisition posted for a period of time for which an agency portal and a specific agent are invited to refer candidates.

This field represents the date when the requisition is available on the agency portal.
Attribute required for the search feature.

This field indicates the posting status of the requisition on the agency portal. Possible values are: 1=scheduled, 2=posted, 3=unposted or 4=expired, 6=error, 20=new.

Credential is the representation of all authentication information and identification information used to authenticate a career section user.
This flags tells if the credential will be forced to change is password once he will be authenticated properly.
Global unique identifier for this credential. This is then used to find this user across Taleo's products

This flags checks if the migration mechanism is showed to the credential. This flag will be enabled if his username is his email address. Once the user has changed is user name from his email address to a valid user name, this flag is set to false. Then, this user will not be able to access the migration mechanism again.
Credential's password. The password is hashed so that nobody can read it.
To be documented.
Credential's user name.
Agent entity related to this entity.
Candidate entity related to this credential.

Candidate is one of the most important aspect in the recruitment process. A candidate is an individual about whom a customer possesses relevant information, such as his/her Profile and Personal Info. This information may be acquired as follows: - Most often, the candidate provides it when he/she applies on a position using a requisition or through unsolicited manner. This can be done using an electronic application or through regular mail. - In some cases, the candidate may not have provided the some information. The candidate can be an individual that do not work for the company or it can be an internal employee.

This field contains the number of applications that the candidate has. This field is incrementd when the candidate apply on a requisition and the cie setting DisplayIncompleteApplication is set to 1. If the later cie setting is set to 0, the count will be incremented only when the application become completed.
The first part of the personal address of the candidate.
The second part of the personal address of the candidate.
Indicates if the candidate wants to remain anonymous. An anonymous candidate has not gave his firstname and lastname.
The date at which the candidate will be able to start to work.
The date on which the candidate is born.

This field is read-only and it is for internal uses. This field indicate if the candidate has more than one active application (=2) or if the candidate has only one active application (=1). This field is never persisted.
The city of the personnal adress of the candidate.
The date when the candidate has been created.
The date on which the candidate advance in the hiring process for the last time.

The general profile disqualifier result date of the candidate (knockout status).
The date when the candidate disqualifier result has been evaluated according to its answers to the general company disqualification questions. A corresponding disqualifier result is set.
The email address of the candidate. This field is automatically trimmed and lower cased when updated.
The employee number of the candidate if this this one is an internal employee.
The personnal fax number of the candidate.
The first name of the candidate.
Indicate if the candidate has referred another candidate.
The personnal home phone of the candidate.
This field contains the last date that a modification has been made on the candidate. Ether on his personnal or his progression in the hiring process, or any other changes.
Indicate if the candidate is involved in at least one hiring process on a requisition. The field activeApplicationsCount must be loaded in order to have a valid value in this field.

Indicate if the candidate is an internal employee or not. A candidate that apply on a internal career site is set to internal automatically. Thus, if a candidate is hired and the cie setting AutomaticallyIdentifyCandidateAsInternal is set to 1, a task (IdentifyCandidateAsInternalTask) will be created to set the field to true when the start date is reached.

This field indicate if the candidate manifested his desired to be employed by the cie. He has applied on at least one requisition or he has submitted his profile. If the candidate is only a referrer, this field will be false.

This private field is used to optimized batch process on candidate. The concept of "Hourly candididate" does not exist in taleo system. This field is managed with the following algorithm: Yes: When he applied only on Hourly Requisition(s). No: From the moment a candidate applies on a professionnal or campus requisition, or when he submits his profile. This field is populated by trigger. Do not import this field.

This field is read-only. It indicate if the candidate has NOT given his firstname and his lastname and he had not indicated that he whiches to be anonymous when he entered his personnal informations. This field is never persisted.
This field is for internal uses. It indicate if the personal informations have been masked by the Squeezer policy the perform a soft delete. Not importable.
This field is read-only. It contains the most recent date between the last modified date and the csw latest date.
This field contains the date of the last application of the candidate. This column has been added to correct a performance issue in the squeezer engine.
The date on which the candidate as been modified for the last time.
The last name of the candidate.
The middle initial of the candidate.
The personnal mobile phone of the candidate.
The unique identifier of this entity.
Indicate if the candidte which to be notify by email when a new requisition that match his profile is posted on the career site.
The personnal pager phone of the candidate.
Indicate if the personnal informations has been validated or not by the candidate.

This field holds the value for the prefix name of the candidate.
i.e Mr, Mrs, etc.
The date on which the candidate has been referred.
The end date of the candidate's referral. It is calculated with the "ReferenceDate" to which we add the number of days contained in the "ERTReferralValidityPeriod" cieSetting.
Indicate if the candidate is referrer by an agent or by a referrer.
The salary the candidate whiches to have.
The social security number of the candidate.

This field holds the value for the suffix name of the candidate.
i.e Eng, MD, etc.
The url of the web site of the candidate.
The phone of the candidate where he is working right now.
The zip code of the personnal address of the candidate. This field, when updated, will trigerred automatically the update of the geo conding informations.

Represents an answer to a question by a given candidate.
If the answer has a textual explanation, then there is no possible answer nor disqualifier result associated to it.
Otherwise, the answer has a possible answer which coresponds to a choice presented to the candidate. A disqualifier result may be associated when the question is a disqualification question type.
The question answer can be provided by the candidate or by any user of the system owning the required privileges.

This field represents the ISO4217 alphabetic code of the currency. In most cases, it is composed of the country's two-character Internet country code plus an extra character to denote the currency unit. For example, the code for Canadian Dollars is simply Canada's two-character Internet code ("CA") plus a one-character currency designator ("D").
This field represents the ISO4217 numeric code of the currency.
This field is the symbol of the currency. For instance th symbol of the US dollar is '$'.

The UDSElement entity models user-defined selection elements. A selection element is a possible value of the selection (discrete value). A selection element may then be used as a UDF (user-defined field) value.
Indicates if this selection element is active. An inactive element will normally be hidden in the user interface.
An alphanumeric code that uniquely identifies the element.

Indicates if the selection element has all the required information entered. The required information is the description for all content languages. An incomplete element should not be shown in the UI.
The UDSElement internal identifier specified by the customer. Used for referencing a UDSElement identifier known in another external system for integration purposes.
The descriptive name of the selection element.
The date from element takes effect, if any. The effectiveFrom and effectiveTill fields are considered by the system only if their parent selection enables effective dates.
The date the element becomes inactive, if any.
The last modification date of the UDSElement
The unique identifier of this entity.
The default display sequence of the element.
JobFields for which this selection element is active.
Locations for which this selection element is active.
Organizations for which this selection element is active.
Indicates in which selection this element belongs. That selection's attributes influence how an element is to be used and displayed in the user interface.
The UserDefinedSelection entity models user-defined selections. A selection (domain of discrete values) may then be used to define user-defined fields.
Alphanumeric code that uniquely identifies the selection.
The UserDefinedSelection internal identifier specified by the customer. Used for referencing a UserDefinedSelection identifier known in another external system for integration purposes.

Indicates if the elements of this selection can specify an activation period. If this field is set to false, any dates in the 'effectiveFrom' and 'effectiveTill' fields of the elements will not be considered.
Indicates that this selection handles a large amount of elements.
Descriptive name of the selection.
The unique identifier of this entity.
Indicates if all elements of this selection must be linked to at least one structure element.
The meta-class of one of the following: Organization, Location, JobField. Elements linked to this selection must only be linked to that type of structure.
Contains the elements of this selection.
Indicates the origin of this selection (either built in by Taleo, or company-specific data).
Indicates which languages are required to make this user-defined selection complete.

A work item represents a task that is assigned to a user of the Taleo system.
A comment entered by the user who created the work item.
The date and time the work item was created.
The user to whom this workitem is assigned.
The user who created the workitem.
The state of the work item before being put on hold.
The current state of the work item.
The type of work item.
Defines categories in which work items can be classified. Currently two categories exist: Assignable and Automatic.

Defines states in which a work item can be. There are currently two possible states.
Active, which indicates that the workitem is ready to be read and realized. This is the initial status. The second state is On Hold, which suspends a work item.
For example, when a requisition is put on hold, all its related workitems are automatically put on hold. They are resumed as soon as the requisition is resumed.
Defines the kinds of work items that exist in the Taleo system. Each type of work item is also associated to a category.
Describes the action that the user receiving this type of work item is expected to take.
The category in which this work item type is classified.

Application is the centerpiece of the selection process. All actions and events are based and take place on the application. An application is created as soon as a candidate is matched to a requisition, whatever the way (mail application, use of career section, automatic match, reference).

This class is use to store a pair of informations (token ,value) to help build the column details that is displayed into the column details. Suppose that we have a detail string that look like that : "Hello {token_example} !!!" And suppose that we have a token "token_example" who is value is "World". When the replacement will be done, we will have this detail string : Hello World !!!
The token is a string that we need to replace with it's value to build the detail string that will be displayed.
The value is string that will replace the token string to build the detail string that will be displayed.

A Source is a medium or event through which a candidate has heard about the job you are posting or about your company. The candidate may also have applied on a job through different sources.
Sources may be as diverse as Internet job boards, job fairs, magazines and specialized trade publications, newspapers, professional associations, mailing lists, recruiting agencies, etc.

Represents the preferences that the candidate can configure from the Career Site. The candidate selects the values that fit him best and save them in the database via this entity. These preferences are later checked by the process that must take them into account. For example, the "sendApplicationAknowledgement" attribute must be checked to determine if the related corresponding must be sent to a candidate.

Contains the time zone selected by the candidate or agent. If the candidate or agent did not select a time zone, the system will use the time zone corresponding to the candidate's residence. If the residence has not been provided by the candidate, the system will take the time zone of the browser. Finally, if no time zone can deducted from the request, the default time zone (company setting) will be taken into account.
Determines if the Acknowledgement Letter must be sent to the candidate or not.
Determines if the Job Posting Notification must be sent to the candidate or not. If yes, it takes the value of attribute "jobPostingNoticeFrequency" into account.

Determines if the Job Agent Notification(s) must be sent to the candidate or not. If yes, it takes the value of attribute "jobPostingNoticeFrequency" into account, unless it has been explicitly overridden in the job agent itself.
Determines if the Rejection Letter (sent when a requisition is filled or canceled) must be sent to a candidate.

Class that represents a company"s specific location. A company location represents a geographical region. Only locations that are useful to the company are present in this structure. Location is used in the application to define a country; it could also define a State (or province), a region and a city. It usually describes locations where activities happen within the company. As far as country, state and region are concerned, they should be a subset of the reference location structure.
The Location internal identifier specified by the customer. Used for referencing a location identifier known in another external system for integration purposes.

Class that represents a network-specific location. Taleo locations are a list of locations from around the world. They are usually used to generate the locations of a company, and they are also used in the Career Section to help a candidate select the actual location. They also represent the location used to do a posting, since posting is often done based on a "region" (which is less detailed than the city used in Location). The reference location structure has 3 levels: country, province/state and region.
ISO3166Alpha3 code of the location

This is the generic abstract entity providing the specification of a possible answer.
It is associated with only one question and represents one of the possible answers that can be chosen from when answering a question. The format of the question must be single or multiple answer, not text answer.
This is the sequence of the possible answers for a specific question.
This is the associated question for this answer
This is the associated type for this possible answer.
This is the type of a possible answers. Possible values Undisclosed, Not Specified are applicable for all regulation question types. Other types only apply to one question type.

This is the generic abstract entity providing the specification of a question.
A given question can only be used in one type of question. When the format of the question is not Text Answer, the question comes with a set of possible answers from which the user can choose.
This is the associated format of question for this question.
This is the associated type for this question.
This is the generic abstract entity providing the specification of an answer to a question. This is the entity a concrete answer must inherit from and define other associations.

The performer key associated to the answer. It indicates who has entered the answer for the provider. For example, a recruiter may enter an answer for a candidate. The candidate is the provider but the recruiter is the performer.
The performer type of the answer. It indicates the type of who has entered the answer for the provider.
The provider key associated to the answer. It indicates who has answered or for whom the answer is provided. For example, a candidate may be the provider of an answer.
The provider type of the answer. It indicates the type of who has answered or for whom the answer is provided.
Indicates when the answer has been provided.
This is the origin of the answer. An answer populated by the system after a conversion or an answer directly fed by the end user.

Ths possible answer associated to the answer. This is one of the answer choices. A single answer question must have only one possible answer associated to the answer. The TextAnswer attribute is ignored. A multiple answer question may lead to multiple answers. The TextAnswer attribute is ignored. A text answer question must not have any possible answer associated to the answer. The TextAnswer attribute must be filled.
The question associated to the answer.
The question type associated to the answer. The type associated to the question and the possible answer must be of the same type for this answer.
This is a display option. It defines how answer choice entries will be displayed and entered.
This is the generic abstract entity providing the specification of a question form. A form is a set of questions.
This is the format of Question. It indicates how it can be answered. Possible values are Single Answer, Multiple Answer and Text Answer.
This is the type of question form. It determines the usage of the question form.
This is a question scope. It defines the scope of a question.
This is the type of question. It determines the usage of the question. Prescreening, Security and EmployementEquity are some exemples.
This is the concrete entity of a question form used for regulation purposes. A regulation form is linked to a company locations.
The Company Locations to which the form is linked. If not empty, the form is company specific
This is the concrete entity of a possible answer used for regulation purposes.
This is the associated type for this question.
This is the concrete entity of a question used for regulation purposes.

This is the concrete entity of an answer used for regulation purposes.

To be documented.
This is the type of regulation question. Ethnicity, race and gender are a few examples configured in the system. This information is set for a question only when QuestionType = REGULATION
This is the list of possible answer types associated to this question regulation type.

This entity represents one of the workflow elements. When all the elements are completed, the workflow is considered completed. The steps are built based on an StepDefinition. The steps can be processed by Users or Systems and can have specializations and also different durations.
The StepApplicationDefinition represents a specialization of the StepDefiniton; StepTaskDefinition is the only specialization of the StepApplicationDefinition.

The step definition is the super interface of all definitions. The step definition only specifies the incoming transitions, the outgoing ones and the process to which the step is linked. All other possible attributes for a step are delegated to the specializations.
The physical key of the entity.

ExecutionSequence is arbitrary index (nullable) not used directly by the workflow engine. Two or more activities definition can have the same executionSequence inside one process definition. Application can set this sequence in order to have logical suite of activities (approval path use this sequence).
Name identifying the step definition.
The step task definition represents the definition of which task will be executed when the StepTask will be reached.

The role represent the role of an actor; it can be a system role or a user defined role.
The Hierarchical role represent a role hierarchy within a business. This role is assigned to users. There can be one and only one parent of the role in the hierarchy..
The regional assigne represent a user map on a userdefined role.

The user defined role represent a role that is created and modified by the user. This role can have a regional assignee. The user defined role must have a default assignee to fall back when no other user can be resolved.
